I found several excellent educational resources for teaching Treasure Island in the classroom. Here are the key options available:

## Comprehensive Teaching Guides

Memoria Press offers a complete Treasure Island Set that includes the text, Student Study Guide, and Teacher Guide, with study guides that train students to become active readers by focusing on vocabulary, pronunciation, spelling, comprehension, and composition skills. The Teacher Guide is meant to be used in conjunction with the Student Study Guide and includes answers to questions plus quizzes and final tests.

The Core Knowledge Foundation provides CKLA Unit 8: Treasure Island, where students explore the literary text as an adventure story while focusing on character development, setting, plot, and literary devices, with a comprehensive Teacher Guide that specifies learning objectives and provides background information, daily lesson plans, and assessments.

## Grade-Specific Resources

TeacherVision offers a printable literature guide designed for 9th-12th grade students, while many resources cater to elementary and middle school levels as well.

## Teachers Pay Teachers Materials

Teachers Pay Teachers hosts numerous Treasure Island literature guide resources, including comprehensive novel studies that are both printable and Google-ready for digital learning. These include complete novel study packs with comprehension questions, author research activities, vocabulary work, discussion questions, cause and effect analysis, and character development materials.

## Interactive and Digital Resources

Many resources are available on Teachers Pay Teachers that include Google Slideshows following teacher guides for both in-class and virtual instruction. Some materials align with Core Knowledge curriculum and can supplement units with additional reading and writing skills practice, perfect for small group instruction or independent work.

## Creative Teaching Ideas

LitWits offers free creative teaching ideas including meaningful projects, hands-on activities, and other resources specifically for teaching Treasure Island by Robert Louis Stevenson.

These resources provide a comprehensive range of options for educators teaching Treasure Island, from traditional study guides to modern digital resources, catering to different grade levels and teaching approaches.
